result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Heather L. Spinler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Heather L. Spinler was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning January 6, 2023 and increasing to $50.00 a month beginning April 6, 2023.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  Defendant's bond of $500.00 has been applied towards the fine and costs.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample a the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: See count 2 for payment of fine and costs.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Credit given for any administrative suspension.
Defendant shall complete an AODA and comply with the driver safety plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather L. Spinler

records.addlTxt: Ignition Interlock Device Court Order

3:45 PM Defendant Heather L. Spinler in court, in custody.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Heather L. Spinler.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Plea of no contest to count 2 and count 4.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 and count 4. Court dismisses count 5.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.   Statement by Attorney Laufenberg.  Court orders on count 2 - $100.00 fine plus costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Court orders on count 4 -  90 days county jail with huber and good time; $2,500.00 fine; DNA sample; 28 month driver's license revocation; IID; $42.00 blood draw and AODA. 24 days of sentence credit.  Court reopens 22TR205 and 22TR206 and dismisses those charges.  The fine and costs shall be combined into one payment plan of $25.00 a month beginning January 6, 2023 and increase to $50.00 a month beginning on April 6, 2023.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid  driver's license.  Defendant shall not enter the Brass Rail establishment. Initial Appearance set May 3, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.
Taylor County Arrest Report

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather L. Spinler appeared in person, in custody.    Victim notification has been complied.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with T.A.Y. - dob:  11-3-1991; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; shall not enter the Brass Rail establishment.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
